projects.Name: Car OBD II
projects.Introduction: Most modern cars use what is known as On-board diagnostic. I did some research so I can do basic diagnostics on my car.

blurbs.title: Connecting to Bluetooth
blurbs.text: Connect the OBD II scanner into the slot in your car. I used Linux on my laptop to connect to it. The device will pair but does not connect so I had to connect a raw serial terminal to a bluetooth connection. To connect to the raw serial use the command sudo rfcomm connect /dev/rfcomm0 MAC_ID 1 &. For more context, /dev/ is where input device files generally reside.

blurbs.title: Scanner software
blurbs.text: There are a couple of open source options to read the scanner output. I used a program that was based on pyOBD. The version of pyOBD I used had been reworked a little and it worked well. The documentation provided was straight forward and I followed it to ge the program running.
